questions.question: What point of view is used in this novel?

choices.answer: First person - Opal's Point of View
First Person - the Preacher's Point of View
Third Person limited to Opal
Third Person limited to Winn Dixie

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Opal's relationship with her father?

choices.answer: They fight all of the time.
They get along well.
Jealous of how much attention he pays to Winn Dixie.
They are always competing with one another.

questions.question: Which of the following human-like abilities does Winn Dixie have?

choices.answer: He can say "I love you."
He can shake hands.
He can smile.
He can play hide-and-seek.

questions.question: What was Opal's first impression of Winn Dixie?

choices.answer: He was ugly, stinky, and she was afraid to touch him.
He was the cutest dog she had ever seen.
He was very small but very clean.
He was ugly, but she already liked him a whole lot.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the preacher?

choices.answer: lazy and selfish
sickly and weak
busy yet concerned
mean yet helpful

questions.question: According to Opal, how are Opal and Winn Dixie alike when she first takes him home?

choices.answer: Both of them have matted hair.
Neither one of them likes to take baths.
Both of them have busy fathers.
Both of them are lonely.

questions.question: How many things does Opal ask her father to tell her about her mother?

choices.answer: two things
five things
ten things
as many things as he can think of

questions.question: "...She likes to plant things.  She had a talent for it."  What does this passage mean?

choices.answer: Opal's mom was magic
Opal's mom knew how to make cars.
Opal's mom could not grow anything.
Opal's mom could grow anything she wanted.

questions.question: What did Winn-Dixie do the first time Opal and the preacher tied him up outside of the church?

choices.answer: He got loose and ran inside the church
He dug a huge hole in the ground.
He howled so loud that everyone in the church could hear.
He laid down and went to sleep.

questions.question: In the book we learn about how lonely Opal is.  What type of conflict is this?

choices.answer: internal
external
internal and external
NOT internal or external

questions.question: Why did Miss Franny think that Winn-Dixie was a bear when she saw him looking in the window?

choices.answer: She heard him growl, and it sounded like a bear.
She had once had a bear come into the library before.
She thought Winn-Dixie's paw was too big to be a dog's paw.
She was reading the story The Three Bears at the ime.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Amanda Wilkinson?

choices.answer: snooty and rude
shy and quiet
outgoing and hyper
sweet and giving

questions.question: How did Opal talk Otis into giving her the leash and collar for Winn-Dixie?

choices.answer: She told him she would give him her allowance every week.
She told him she would feed his parrot for him every day.
She told him that she would come in and clean for him.
She told him that she would trade something special.
a parrot
the woman who runs the store
a dog
the owner of the trailer park
